Key Match Events: Brennan Johnson scored his seventh goal in seven games
Logi Tómasson sent an immaculate left-foot shot into the far corner
Danny Ward’s 72nd-minute own goal gifts Iceland an equaliser
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy was beginning to make this coaching lark all look rather straightforward
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy said that there is a lot to benefit from the draw for Wales, and that it allows them to coach more and put a library in the players’ heads
Åge Hareide praised his team for lifting themselves and coming back in the second half, and said that they should have won the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in sub-zero temperatures, and a couple of Wales supporters went down to their underwear despite the cold
The stadium was surrounded by stunning scenery
Others: The match was part of the Nations League competition
Neco Williams had a flawless first half but for taking a boot from Stefán Thordarson
